esriDocumentation.additionalInformation:
For each `stretchType` there are specific sets of requirements that are as follows:
`none`: does not require other parameters.
`standardDeviation`: requires numberOfStandardDeviations, statistics, or dra.
`histogramEqualization`: requires the source dataset to have histograms or additional dra.
`minMax`: requires statistics or dra.
`percentClip`: requires minPercent, maxPercent, and dra.
`sigmoid`: does not require other parameters. Optionally, set the sigmoidStrengthLevel (1 to 6) to adjust the curvature of Sigmoid curve used in color stretch.

description: Displays continuous raster cell values across a gradual ramp of colors. Use this renderer to draw a single band of continuous data. This renderer works well when you have a large range of values to display, such as with imagery or scientific data.
title: Raster Stretch Renderer

___type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

___sigmoidStrengthLevel.description: Set this from (1 to 6) to adjust the curvature of Sigmoid curve used in color stretch.

$eref.description: A colorRamp object is used to specify a range of colors that are applied to a group of symbols.
$eref.title: Color Ramp

___fromColor.description: Array representing the initial color to start the ramp from.

___colorRamps.description: A multipart color ramp is defined by a list of constituent color ramps.

___type.description: Value indicating the type of colorRamp.

___algorithm.description: Algorithm used for calculating the ramp.

___toColor.description: Array representing the final color to end the ramp with.

___stretchType.description: The stretch types for stretch raster function.

___numberOfStandardDeviations.description: The number of standard deviations for standard deviation stretch.

___useGamma.description: Indicates if the renderer applies Gamma stretch.

___dra.description: Indicates if Dynamic Range Adjustment should be applied.

___computeGamma.description: Indicates if gamma values should be computed by default.
